content:
The Identity Verification feature gives you the ability to verify the identity of a caller before sharing sensitive information with them. How you verify the identity depends on how your admin has configured the process.

With the default configuration, agents can verify a caller’s account name, birth date, phone number, and postal code using text-based search on Account records. The agent must check at least one optional question.

The Identity Verification feature consists of Identity Verification objects, Engagement Interaction objects, and identity verification flows. How a call center agent verifies a caller’s identity depends on the identity verification flow template used to configure the process.

You may be required to verify the caller’s identity or store interaction details. If someone is calling on another person’s behalf, you must verify two identities.

To pass configuration information to the flow, create an Identity Verification Process Definition record and define the layout of the search screen. You can specify the minimum number of additional verifying questions to ask a caller by creating an Identity Verification Process Detail record.

The Identity Verification Process Field object enables you to determine what an agent sees in search results or which fields must be verified. Create an Identity Verification Process Field record for each field that is part of your identity verification process.

Create a flow using the Verify Caller Identity or Verify Customer Identity flow template, depending on the kind of identity verification required by your organization. Make the flow available to agents and enable them to perform identity verification.

If data resides outside of Salesforce, configure the identity verification process to use external data.
title: Identity Verification in Salesforce
